issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After upgrading from 4.1.2 to 4.2.x all UFS servers in the cloud should have a dns service registered per UFS server. This is not occurring. Further, attempts to manually register a dns service on UFS servers with missing dns fails with this error:
failed because of Unable to register more than one service in a partition for component type: dns
This issue has been re-created in the PRC on the following systems:
10.104.10.19 - CLC/Walrus/CC/SC/UFS1
10.104.10.22 - UFS2
10.104.10.29 - NC
The process to recreate was as follows:
1) Install 4.1.2 with calyptos.
2) Check service listing and noted 2 user-api services, one on .19 and one on .22. Noted one dns service on .19
3) Upgrade the installation to 4.2.2.
4) Check service listing and noted 2 user-api services, one on .19 and one on .22. Noted one dns service on .19
5) Tried to manually create the second dns service on .22 with this command - euserv-register-service -t dns -h 10.104.10.22 10.104.10.22_dns --debug. It failed with the output in dns-register.out (attached to SUP).
On a new install it is noted that dns is registered on each UFS server.
Customer sosreports are located on 10.104.10.63:/sos/nsn/1278/1278
Customer did provide evidence on what a new cloud install with multiple UFS looks like in Zendesk ticket 1278.
fields.summary: Upgrading euca 4.1.2 to 4.2.2 dns is not registered on additional UFS servers

comments.body:
In upgrade case, it is expected that DNS runs with CLC (eucalyptus service), but not on UFS (https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-10910). The failure to manually register appears to be a tool's UX issue (cc: [~gholms]). This command line should work:

euserv-register-service -t dns -h 10.104.10.22 -z 10.104.10.22_dns 10.104.10.22_dns

[~spark]  We are seeing the following error when we run the following 'euserv-register-service -t dns -h 10.104.10.22 -z 10.104.10.22_dns 10.104.10.22_dns' on an upgraded 4.1.2 to 4.2.2  installation?

This appears to be a new error added  in AbstractServiceBuilder.java 4.2 ?
[~mmunn1] Did you specify '-z 10.104.10.22_dns'? I don't see it in the pasted command line. The issue was missing partition field.
